author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the following guidelines for auto-merging:

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with a capital letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, ends in lowercase

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
I'll update the name and resubmit.
Is this a bug in the AutoMerge bot?
Maybe. So far as I can tell, all of the files point to the new name `Arviz`, while only the name of the PR points to the old name `ArviZ`.

Maybe it's just that your comment blocked the merge? I think maybe you can edit your comments and add [noblock] to help it.

[noblock]
What's the bug? New packages are merged after 3 days. Also, isn't `ArviZ` a better name given that the python package is named that?

AutoMerge reports
```julia
 ┌ Info: This is a new package pull request
│   pkg = "ArviZ"
└   version = v"0.1.0"
ERROR: SystemError: opening file "/home/runner/work/General/General/A/ArviZ/Package.toml": No such file or directory
```
in https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/5280/checks?check_run_id=297369941 so I was wondering if the name change caused problems.
Probably because https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/Registrator.jl/pull/239 is not deployed yet

> Also, isn't ArviZ a better name given that the python package is named that?

I agree now, I think ArviZ.jl will be the least confusing confusing option. Can someone change back the PR title? I'll then revert the name change and retrigger. Sorry everyone for all the hassle!
